body_content.explanation: either of the two equal or nearly equal parts that together make up a whole:
examples: "What's half of 96?" "48."
Roughly half (of) the class are Spanish and the others are a mixture of nationalities.
Cut the apple in half/into halves (= into two equal parts).
My little brother is half as tall as me/half my height.
Can you get me half a dozen (= six) eggs, please?
Half of me would just like to give it all up and travel around the world (= partly I would like to, but partly I would not).
She was born in the latter half of the 18th century.
The recipe tells you to use a pound and a half of butter.
She invited a lot of people to the party but half of them didn't turn up.
I don't even know where she is half (of) the time.

body_content.explanation: Half past a particular hour is 30 minutes later than that hour:
examples: I'll meet you at half past nine (= 09.30 or 21.30).
He answered the door half naked.
I was half expecting to see her at the party.
I'm half inclined to take the job just because it's in Argentina.
He was being funny but I think he was half serious.
The bottle's half empty.

body_content.explanation: to divide the cost of something with someone:
examples: Shall we go halves on a bottle of champagne?

body_content.explanation: equal amounts of two different things:
examples: The waste is mixed half and half with reclaimed wood and turned into decking.

body_content.explanation: 50 percent more of the existing number or amount:
examples: Last year, we raised almost £15,000. This year we raised about half as much again.

body_content.explanation: either of two periods of time into which a game is divided:
examples: He has only made one NFL start and was pulled out after an ineffective first half.

body_content.explanation: in team sports, either of the two halves into which the playing area is divided:
examples: His attacking instincts often find him playing in the opposition's half.
A long kick allowed Bath to break into the Bristol half.
We're giving away too many silly fouls, especially in our own half.

body_content.explanation: in team sports such as football, rugby, and hockey, a player who plays mostly in the middle of the playing area:
examples: They have two young halves, who will only get better.
The halves played close in front of the defending centre-half.

body_content.explanation: in golf, a score for a hole that is the same as your opponent's score:
examples: She holed from six feet for a half at the seventeenth.
It was only with an 18-inch putt for a half at the 15th that he claimed the match, and his team's victory.

body_content.explanation: half a pint of a drink, especially beer:
examples: A pint of lager and two halves, please.

body_content.explanation: a ticket that is cheaper because it is for a child:
examples: Two (adults) and three halves to Manchester, please.
